channel.title: One Page Template
channel.description:
Hey guys, this is my first template ever so it's not going to be great. I wanted to start making cool home pages and sell them once I get better (not on here of course). This is just the template so I will have further updates when I get the HTML done too. Tell me what you think and don't forget to criticize me :P
[img]http://oi62.tinypic.com/11bue0n.jpg[/img]

item.title: One Page Template
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Seeing as the main organization of your design is centered (by the way, don’t continue that with the text in the boxes; either align left or justify the text in those), it would be practical to keep the design elements centered as well, which would include the light sources.

Read full topic

item.title: One Page Template
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

The Web Guy:

I think the padding of the main container is too much (on the left and right) and the “Recent News and Updates” and “Server Information” boxes don’t look right, but I’m still trying to figure out why they don’t look right… But it’s a pretty decent template. I would have to give it 7/10. Background choice is a 9.5/10.

Thanks for the help! I will try to reduce the padding and change up the information boxes to make them blend in more. Thank you.

[quote=“John, post:7, topic:542396”]Is this made in code or as a Photoshop design?
Traditionally its a good design habit to keep a majority of the site’s elements within a single main container, and in this case I’d include the footer content within the container as well. Try either Lato or Roboto font for the navigation bar, and for the main content area decrease the padding on the sides. Also, the light source in the information boxes seems off centered, at least to me. I’m not sure if that’s intended but it’d be more fitting in the middle. The box shadow around the main content container is too opaque, make it more spreaded with a higher opacity.
Otherwise, good choice of background and colour scheme, and hopefully we’ll be able to critique your code at some point as well. :)[/quote]

Thanks for all the useful help. I will definitely take all of your advice into account. The light-sources were supposed to be slightly off-centered. Do you think I should change that? Thanks for all of the help.

Read full topic

item.title: One Page Template
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Is this made in code or as a Photoshop design?
Traditionally its a good design habit to keep a majority of the site’s elements within a single main container, and in this case I’d include the footer content within the container as well. Try either Lato or Roboto font for the navigation bar, and for the main content area decrease the padding on the sides. Also, the light source in the information boxes seems off centered, at least to me. I’m not sure if that’s intended but it’d be more fitting in the middle. The box shadow around the main content container is too opaque, make it more spreaded with a higher opacity.
Otherwise, good choice of background and colour scheme, and hopefully we’ll be able to critique your code at some point as well.

Read full topic

item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:2, topic:542396”]I’m not going to download it to review your code so you might want to post it somewhere.

The design is sickening most specifically how that nav bar is and layout.[/quote]

b00mz1029:

This is just the template so I will have further updates when I get the HTML done too.

How about you post something helpful or gtfo the forums.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:3, topic:542396”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=661272.msg4420360#msg4420360 date=1398096034]
The design is sickening most specifically how that nav bar is and layout.
[/quote]Wtf, it looks decent. I give it a 6.5/10

Nav bar needs a different font[/quote]

What style font do you think it needs? Like a basic arial, a bold font, or something fancy?
